senses.sense_definition: The wise men from the East who visited and gave gifts to the baby Jesus, traditionally celebrated at Epiphany.

examples.text: The <w>Magi</w> followed the bright star across the desert to find the newborn king.
In the nativity play, three children dressed up as the <w>Magi</w> bearing gold, frankincense, and myrrh.

senses.sense_definition: The three bright stars that form the belt of the constellation Orion.

examples.text: On a clear winter night, you can easily identify the <w>Magi</w> in the center of the hunter constellation.
Ancient sailors often navigated using the position of the <w>Magi</w> in the sky.
The ancient Persian <w>magi</w> were renowned for their wisdom and knowledge of the stars.
In the fantasy novel, a council of powerful <w>magi</w> gathered to protect the realm.
Several <w>magi</w> combined their magical energy to cast a protective shield.
The guild of <w>magi</w> required years of study before an apprentice could join.

senses.sense_definition: An acronym for Modified Adjusted Gross Income, a financial metric used in tax calculations.

examples.text: Your eligibility for certain tax deductions depends on whether your <w>MAGI</w> falls below the threshold.
The accountant asked for additional documents to accurately calculate the client's <w>MAGI</w>.
